text:
The SUTD Fabrication Lab is literally a one stop centre for students to realise their project ideas. Now while this is a one stop fabrication cum machining cum 3D printing space, don't expect professional grade products. It is meant to produce prototypes but if a pro grade product does roll out, it only speaks of the effort the student has shown.
There a host of tools and equipment available, from specialised water jet cutters to laser cutters. The 2 storeyed lab is sectioned into metal work, wood work and an open space area for general work.
Safety is of the utmost importance hence you'll find fab lab staff easily available and willing to assist students so that accidents can be prevented.
Located in a central part of the campus, it is accessible 24hrs for students to work on their ideas and projects.
This is a university facility and hence, only staff and students have access.
For the general public, keep a lookout for SUTD's Open House. During this event, the public can access the Fab Lab and be treated to souvenirs crafted in-house by the Fab Lab staff.
Great place to fabricate and assemble your prototypes and models, has all the space, tools and machines you need like workstations, laser cutters, 3D printers etc.
Good facilities and amazing equipment! Loved my times visiting there and using the space
The facilities are well-equipped and the staff are enthusiastic about teaching. Unfortunately, not many students use it.
